fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce:
- Install JIRA (5.0 beta 3 - build 706)
- Run Setup Wizard
- Step 4: Select "Email Notification:" enable
- fill in valid details (a gmail account in this case)
- click "Test Connection"

h4. expected Result:
Testing the mail server connection ...

h4. result instead:
Setup wizard instantly jumps back to Step 2 with no / default values filled in the form


Experienced during two completely different fresh installs on two different computers.

I assume attaching log files etc. doesn't make much sense in this case. And I'll rather not reproduce it since that would require yet another new installation ...
fields.summary: Setup Wizard Step 4 (Email Notification): Clicking "Test Connection" instantly leads back to Step 2

fields.description:
When I want to use the Issue Actions directly on the Dashboard within a Filter Results Gadget, the Dashboard page scrolls up when hover the Actions select box, which makes the Actions selection impossible. It only happens when the gadget is placed where you first need to scroll down.

The problem does not occur in Jira 4.4, but I reproduced it on several 4.4.3 installations, even on this atlassian installation.
fields.summary: Issue Actions in the Filter Results Gadget causes automatic scrolling on large Dashboards making Issue Actions unusable

fields.description:
Previous to JIRA 4.4 (and JRA-9), the dates in the xml-view would be a proper RFC-822 "RSS" date, e.g.

bq. <created>Tue, 18 Feb 2003 22:09:44 +1100</created>

But if the user's local is (say) French, it looks like this ([from here|https://jira.atlassian.com/si/jira.issueviews:issue-xml/JRA-1330/JRA-1330.xml?field=created]):

bq. <created>mar., 18 févr. 2003 22:09:44 +1100</created>

This is not a valid [RFC-222|http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc822.html] date, which specifically requires "Tue" etc.
fields.summary: The XML-view incorrectly formats RFC-822 dates in the current user's langauge

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26143].
  {panel}

Class: com.atlassian.sal.jira.lifecycle.JiraLifecycleManager
Method: onJiraStart(JiraStartedEvent event) 

Problem: Documentation for this method is incorrect. Right now it seems to be copied over from other method in this class onFrameworkStart().

It will be great if you can update the documentation. Also can you explain if this method onJiraStart() gets called once JIRA is completely started or before it get started.

This will help us to write the Scheduler JOB if this is really the event fired up when JIRA is completely started.

regards,
Raju

Link to documentation: 
http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/5.0-beta3/com/atlassian/sal/jira/lifecycle/JiraLifecycleManager.html#onJiraStart(com.atlassian.jira.extension.JiraStartedEvent)
fields.summary: Inaccurate documentation for onJiraStart() method for com.atlassian.sal.jira.lifecycle.JiraLifecycleManager

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26140].

Hey Guys,

Currently, the above is only doable through customization of JIRA files. However, some users complain that this is a security problem, and as such, should be changeable without customizating the instance.

One feasible option would be just show the message or not, and not changing the message itself.

Best Regards
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support

fields.description:
When clicking on an action in the dropdown menu of the "Filter Results" Gadget, on Firefox 7.0.1, nothing happens.

Steps to reproduce:

# Add the *Filter Results* gadget
# Select the Filter you created
# Click on the Gear icon next to an issue
# On the dropdown menu, click on any action

Nothing happens.

fields.description:
When administrator try to edit the Issue Type Scheme associated to a project, it display a wrong total number of issues in the project.

Steps to reproduce:
# create a new project
# then, create a few tickets in the project
# then, go to the project created in step 1
# click on the Issue Types tab > Actions > Use a different scheme
# JIRA will shows *There are 0 issues in the project. The current scheme is Issue_Type_Scheme_name* as shown in the screenshot EditIssueTypeScheme.png even though the project has a few tickets already.
fields.summary: Edit Issue Type Scheme Page Shows Incorrect Information

*Steps to reproduce*
# Grant a specific user or group "Administer project" privileges in the permission scheme for a particular project.
# Log in as them, go to the Project Admin page.
# Click "Edit Project" at the top-right to change the name, URL, project lead, or description.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26134].
  {panel}

If there is a network issue, such as not having a proxy set, the plugin management administration fails silently. The existing plugins will display, but when trying to expand them, the screen eventually times out and does not return any information OR a failure. Likewise, one is unable to Upgrade, Install...

These are some of the pages effected:
.../plugins/servlet/upm#manage
.../plugins/servlet/upm#upgrade
.../plugins/servlet/upm#install

It is easy to test this behavior by entering a bad proxy in $JIRA_INSTALL/bin/setenv.sh:

JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS="-Dhttp.proxyHost=proxy.BOGUS.com -Dhttp.proxyPort=1234"

Note that there is no indication on the screen that there was a failure (to reach the Atlassian server). This is a silent failure.
The only hint I could find in the log files was:

[upm.rest.representations.PluginRepresentation] Failed to retrieve Plugin Version from PAC
fields.summary: Plugin management (upm) fails silently when unable to reach Atlassian server (no proxy, firewall, ...)

fields.description:
I'm trying to write a gadget and host it in JIRA. The call to makeRequest is broken when the <base> tag is provided as part of the gadget content. For example, consider the following gadget content:

{quote} 
<![CDATA[
<html>
<head><base href="https://sample.com/" /></head>
<body>
<script>
gadgets.io.makeRequest("http://www.google.com",function(response) { console.debug(response); }, {METHOD: "POST"});
</script>
</body>
</html>
]]>
{quote}  

-------> Notice the <base> tag set to "https://sample.com"

When this gadget runs, JIRA will issue the makeRequest to:
https://sample.com/plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest <------ INCORRECT! JIRA is picking up the href from the <base> tag
INSTEAD OF
https://localhost:8080/plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest

Since the makeRequest call should always be forwarded on to the OpenSocial container (JIRA), it looks as though there is a bug in the way JIRA handles gadgets that supply a <base> tag. 

See the attached file (ExampleGadget.xml) for a simply test case that can be executed.
fields.summary: External gadget can't be added properly to JIRA if gadget uses base tag

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26128].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 16 March 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for your feedback and comments on this issue. We recently implemented JRA-14369, which resolves several of the improvements described on this issue – specifically, you can now selectively add and remove values during a bulk edit operation for JIRA's system multi-select fields, including labels, components, affects versions, and fix versions.

We have decided to close this ticket because we have no plans to address the remaining requests around label management. Our intent is to ensure that there is a functional difference between Components and Labels. One is a lightweight "tag" that any user can create, one is a set of objects created by a project administrator. We would prefer to extend the capabilities of each of these features individually, rather than allow their functionality to overlap more than it already does.

We expect the new bulk edit functionality to make it substantially easier to correct cases where you need to "merge" labels. There is also a [free add-on on the Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/ca.uwo.jira.plugins.labelbot] to assist with this.

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Wouldn't it be nice to have a way to manage Labels, maybe from the Project Administration screen? Currently there is not a way to mass manage Labels. Doing a Bulk Edit on a set of issues replaces (removes) all current Labels with only the new label for all issues, instead of adding the new label to the existing label set for each issue. This makes Bulk Editing Labels almost useless, since it is very uncommon to have issues with all existing Labels in common. Being able to Bulk Add/Remove/Rename a label, would be incredibly convenient. 

Wouldn't it be nice to be able to merge Labels? Sometime users will create different Labels which essentially mean the same thing, management should be able to merge these Labels. For instance 'grey' + 'gray' >> 'grey'.

Wouldn't it be nice for management to be able to lock-down Labels? Sometimes users are just down right bad at creating appropriate Labels, and once a bad label is created, other users start using it as well. Maybe from Project Administration, administrators could create a set of Labels to be used in that project, and then users could only select from that set of Labels. If a user really feels like they need a new label it could always be requested.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26116].
  {panel}

The following has been reported by a JIRA user:

{quote}
1. Create an XML workflow on a test server using "XML" function from WorkFlow --> View Follows
2. Copy the XML to production server
3. On the JIRA production URL, go to Issue --> Workflows Import, select "import a workflow from XML."
4. Enter Name and File Path, click the "Import" button
5. Error occured,
{quote}

Although it's understood that importing workflows form different systems have limitations on them (IE: if there are plugins in the exported system that are not in the imported system that the workflow relies on, it will error)

Unfortunately when an import fails these errors don't mean anything to our customers, they may simply believe that the importer does not work. 

To solve this there could be possibly of mixture of 2 routes:

# Report to the user in plain terms which plugins are missing and ask them to install them
# On error search for those plugins through the UPM and then prompt the user to download them, and (if restart is not required) reattempt the import.

This could prove for a much smoother user experience.
fields.summary: Smart Import Workflow

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26112].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian,

requests from self-refreshing gadgets cause a lot of (unnecessary) firewall traffic, when the JIRA instance is based in a DMZ. The requests go through the firewall because the baseURL variable is set to the NAT address of the instance. Of course it's possible to change the baseURL to localhost, but then links in e-mail subscriptions and notifications wouldn't work any longer. 

That's why I think a seperation into an internal and external baseURL would be very helpful. External baseURL could be used in e-mail notifications. Internal baseURL could be used for operations/requests that don't leave the domain like the refresh of a gadget.

I already had opened a support request https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-95077. There I was pointed here.

Do you need any additional information? If there's already a workaround or a another solution I really would appreciate to read about it.

Kind regards,
Falk

Curse you JIRA !"

Bulk Edit assignee list performance limitation due to using CollectionList
Bulk Edit assignee list performance limitation due to using CollectionList

fields.description:
{panel:title=Notes from Support}h3. Symptom:
When attempting a Bulk Edit, the browser will freeze before the Step 3 of 4 screen appears.

h3. Diagnosis:
For differential diagnosis, create a new project with only one (or very few) issue(s). 
- Test by giving the jira-users group the Assignable Users permission for this project. 
-- Bulk edit should NOT work in this project.
- Test again by reducing Assignable Users to only one user.
-- Bulk edit should return to normal.

h3. Workaround:
As this is an issue that is borne out of the Assignable User Picker, the currently recommended workaround is to limit the number of assignable users by using permissions to pare it down to the smallest group possible.{panel}

From the ticket:

Bulk Edit is broken due to following line of code in getAssigneeOptionsList(BulkEditBean bulkEditBean) method of AssigneeSystemField.java:

users.retainAll(getAssignableUsers(bulkEditBean, issue));

getAssignableUsers(bulkEditBean, issue) method returns Collection <User> object. Therefore, the above code is invoking Collection.retainAll(Collection). Collection.retainAll(Collection) implementations aren't optimized.
When a sufficiently large collection is used as an argument, the performance is pathologically slow. This is a known Issue in JAVA. Please check following bug:

http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=5028425

Performance can be optimized by transforming collection argument to HashSet. Cast return value of getAssignableUsers(bulkEditBean, issue) method to HastSet.

private Collection<User> getAssignableUsers(OperationContext operationContext, Issue issue)
{ return new HashSet<User>(uniqueUsers.values()); }

Please ask JIRA developers to verify this solution.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit assignee list performance limitation due to using CollectionList

fields.description:
Security auditing tests performed on a *Jira Bug Issue and Project Tracking Software* locally running instance shown that the application is succeptible to Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks within this URL:

[/jira/secure/DeletePortalPage.jspa?targetUrl=%2Fjira%2Fsecure%2FDashboard.jspa&searchName=&searchOwnerUserName=&sortColumn=&sortAscending=&pagingOffset=&pageId=11480&totalResultCount=&Delete=Delete]

This vulnerability enables for an attacker to *delete dashboards* through a session created by a valid user logged into the system. Dashboards are created by the logged user and can be deleted without it's consent.

This vulnerability has been made possible because the application is not verifying the existence of the *atl_token* within the given link. Below is an example of the unaltered POST request responsible for deleting a given Dashboard:

{noformat}
POST /jira/secure/DeletePortalPage.jspa HTTP/1.1
Host: 172.21.1.24
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9.2.17) Gecko/20110422 Ubuntu/9.10 (karmic) Firefox/3.6.17
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: pt-br,en-us;q=0.7,en;q=0.3
Accept-Encoding: gzip,deflate
Accept-Charset: ISO-8859-1,utf-8;q=0.7,*;q=0.7
Keep-Alive: 115
Proxy-Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://172.21.1.24/jira/secure/DeletePortalPage!default.jspa?pageId=11480&atl_token=A816-FTT5-H1WF-I743%7C7f4a94ffca7cc3d9c4dced7680bd43d3546133be%7Clin
Cookie: atlassian.xsrf.token=A816-FTT5-H1WF-I743|7f4a94ffca7cc3d9c4dced7680bd43d3546133be|lin; JSESSIONID=86810D1968FE52B22C671B58FEE91D40
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 241

atl_token=A816-FTT5-H1WF-I743%7C7f4a94ffca7cc3d9c4dced7680bd43d3546133be%7Clin&targetUrl=%2Fjira%2Fsecure%2FDashboard.jspa&searchName=&searchOwnerUserName=&sortColumn=&sortAscending=&pagingOffset=&pageId=11480&totalResultCount=&Delete=Delete
{noformat}

By arbitrarily changing this request method to GET, we achieve the following link:

{noformat}
[jira/secure/DeletePortalPage.jspa?atl_token=A816-FTT5-H1WF-I743%7C7f4a94ffca7cc3d9c4dced7680bd43d3546133be%7Clin&targetUrl=%2Fjira%2Fsecure%2FDashboard.jspa&searchName=&searchOwnerUserName=&sortColumn=&sortAscending=&pagingOffset=&pageId=11480&totalResultCount=&Delete=Delete]
{noformat}

By removing the *atl_token* parameter, this link can be sent to anyone as a means of deleting users Dashboards without their consent:

{noformat}
[jira/secure/DeletePortalPage.jspa?targetUrl=%2Fjira%2Fsecure%2FDashboard.jspa&searchName=&searchOwnerUserName=&sortColumn=&sortAscending=&pagingOffset=&pageId=11480&totalResultCount=&Delete=Delete]
{noformat}

By knowing the *pageId* of another user's Dashboard --- and not being in the position to delete it --- an attacker could send the link to the victim, which in turn, would delete her Dashboard.

The image below shows a list of Dashboards created by the victim:

!showDashboards.png!

The following image shows the request generated as a result of the victim's clicking on the link sent by an attacker:

!victimClicksLink.png!

The following image shows the absence of the previously shown Dashboard:

!deletedDashboard.png!
fields.summary: Cross Site Request Forgery - Deleting User's Dashboards

fields.description: Clicking the comment button at the bottom of the page results in the page reloading, but no new text field to enter in a comment.  The URL changes to add a # at the end of the URL.  This button works in Jira version 4.1.2, which we recently upgraded from.  The comment button at the top of the page works correctly.
fields.summary: bottom comment button doesnt work with Internet Explorer 10.

fields.description: We recently upgraded from Jira 4.1.2 to 4.4.3, and in this change, the mouse over events to edit, delete, or link comments do not show.  This prevents users on this browser to be able to edit or delete comment entries.  The attached image shows the difference between Firefox 8 (top) and IE 10 (bottom).  In IE 10, the bar stays blue and moussing over my own Jira entry no longer shows the added buttons.  I have admin level access to our Jira.  This problem did not exist in Jira 4.1.2, and the functions worked as expected with IE 10.  I am also experiencing this in version 4.4.1 on a different website (jira.secondlife.com).
fields.summary: mouse over events do not work with Internet Explorer 10
Dropdown menus and regular links in the subnav should share a weighting system

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26089].
  {panel}

[JIRA Server Hardware Recommendations|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Requirements#JIRARequirements-3ApplicationServer] says:

bq. During evaluation, JIRA will run well on any reasonably fast workstation computer (e.g. 1.5+ Ghz processor). Memory requirements depend on how many projects and issues you will store, but 256MB (of Java heap size) is enough for most evaluation purposes.

However, JIRA 4.4.x is configured to consume minimum ~300MB and max 1GB.

This misleading info can cause some dramas for customers evaluating our applications in virtualised or hosted installs, where resources may be limited.
fields.summary: outdated memory requirement for JIRA installs

fields.description:
Configurations in jira-config.properties breaks if the group name has spaces.
It doesn't work with double quotes or simple quotes neither.

(e.g. jira.search.views.max.unlimited.group = test group)

{panel:title=Workaround| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
The workaround in this situation simply involves escaping the space character.

For Example: 
* Your group is called "test group"
* Set the variable in JIRA_HOME/jira-config.properties to jira.search.views.max.unlimited.group = test\ group
* Note the slash before the space
{panel}
fields.summary: Configurations in jira-config.properties breaks if the group name has spaces.

fields.description:
A JIRA administrator can place certain tags inadvertently unclosed in the Announcement Banner configurations, causing most of JIRA to not render. This includes the administration pane as well, so that the administrator will not be able to fix this behavior via the UI.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
* Edit the announcement banner to include the following:
{code}<script>{code}
* Save

h4. Workaround:
A workaround is to reset the announcement banner to blank via the database:
* Pull up the announcement banner property ID and content via:
{code:sql}select pt.id, pt.propertyvalue from propertytext pt join propertyentry pe on pt.id=pe.id where pe.property_key='jira.alertheader';{code}
* Make a note of the ID number and set the banner contents to blank via:
{code:sql}update propertytext set propertyvalue='' where id='<id from above>';{code}
fields.summary: JIRA pages can be inadvertently "hidden" via announcement banner
Patch develop for email services

fields.description:
When there are about 1000 versions created for a project, JIRA hangs after clicking on the 'Manage Version' link. This popup is showing:

!version.png|thumbnail!

This happens when using FireFox or IE. It works well when using google chrome or opera.
fields.summary: Make Manage Versions screen responsive for large amount of versions (Chrome and Firefox)

fields.description:
Hi!

We hare upgrading to Jira 4.4.1, and testing out the functionality.

We have a cascading select, where I try to add "level 2"-options to the select list.
I almost all the time get the following error:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.customfields.AbstractEditConfigurationItemAction.getCustomField(AbstractEditConfigurationItemAction.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.customfields.EditCustomFieldOptions.doValidation(EditCustomFieldOptions.java:79)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.customfields.EditCustomFieldOptions.doAdd(EditCustomFieldOptions.java:176)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
<.....>
(For full stacktrace and error-page, se attachment)


When pushing backspace to go back in browser history, and trying to add the field once more, it usually works.
But this is very annoying, and slows down the time to udpate the select lists...

Hope there is an answer to this.

I also found this attachment when googling after the problem:
https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/41846/edit+custom+field.txt

Seems someone has had a similar problem...

kindly regards,
Stein
fields.summary: Getting NullPointerException in method getCustomField in AbstractEditConfigurationItemAction

fields.description:
The default workflow in JIRA has two different "Close Issue" transitions: one with an id of 2 (used when closing an issue from Open, In Progress, or Reopened) and one with an id of 701 (used when closing an issue from Resolved). You can see that in the [image|http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/185729632/workflow-viewsteps.png?version=5&modificationDate=1309833420185] showing the workflow steps in the [docs|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Workflow].

This makes it harder to customize the workflow to add custom validators or conditions when closing an issue, because it needs to be configured in two places. I'm sure this would confuse people.
fields.summary: Duplicate "Close Issue" transition in the default workflow
Allow attachments as a column on the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26073].
  {panel}

In 4.4.1 we have users which have duplicate accounts because of their separate account which is in a sub-domain.  I have given the User Directory Sync the base DN, but it should not traverse to the sub-domain unless i explicitly tell it to do so.  All other applications which search LDAP for Microsoft AD do not traverse to any sub-domains unless you tell it to do so.  This is causing even more issues when i tested an upgrade to 4.4.3.

In 4.4.3 the User Directory Sync will not even run successfully because it gets to a group which is also in the sub-domain and throws an error. 

2011-10-26 09:26:31,445 QuartzWorker-0 ERROR ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller] Error occurred while refreshing the cache for directory [ 10000 ].
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: duplicate key: Guests
	at com.google.common.collect.RegularImmutableMap.<init>(RegularImmutableMap.java:62)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap$Builder.fromEntryList(ImmutableMap.java:210)
	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap$Builder.build(ImmutableMap.java:196)
	at com.google.common.collect.Maps.uniqueIndex(Maps.java:456)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher.synchroniseMemberships(AbstractCacheRefresher.java:126)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher.synchroniseAll(AbstractCacheRefresher.java:44)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.UsnChangedCacheRefresher.synchroniseAll(UsnChangedCacheRefresher.java:223)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.synchroniseCache(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:619)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectorySynchroniserImpl.synchronise(DirectorySynchroniserImpl.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller.pollChanges(DbCachingDirectoryPoller.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.monitor.poller.DirectoryPollerJob.execute(DirectoryPollerJob.java:34)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:195)
	at com.atlassian.multitenant.quartz.MultiTenantThreadPool$MultiTenantRunnable.run(MultiTenantThreadPool.java:72)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:520)

This is going to cause major issues and hence prevents us from even thinking about upgrading to any newer version than 4.4.1.

I have also looked into using the LDAP filter to filter out the sub-domain or only filter in the OUs that i want to Sync, but that is impossible.  Due to the LDAP standard for Microsoft AD, you cannot use wildcards when filtering by distinguishedName, so it can't be filtered by OU by that method.
fields.summary: User Directory Sync using Microsoft AD pulls in groups and users from sub-domains when not requested.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26067].
  {panel}

This issues is related to JRA-1423 and JRA-1993 but is distinct.

As a user, I want an Atlassian-supported workflow to set the Estimated Time Remaining to be set to zero when resolving or closing an issue.

The aforementioned bugs indicate a clear need by many people to zero the Estimated Time Remaining on issues upon closing or resolving. The info note on the JIRA close issue form even states "Closing an issue indicates that there is no more work to be done on it, and that it has been verified as complete," which indicates to me that zeroing the remaining time is the expected behavior. This was partially mitigated when using GreenHopper as the close/resolve screens had the default option to zero the remaining time, but this useful feature has been removed from those GreenHopper screens.

Requiring every user to manually add post functions is error-prone and places an undue burden on the end-user. I would prefer this action to be part of the default system workflow; however, it would be acceptable to provide a second system workflow or the option to add the zeroing behavior to the default.
fields.summary: Atlassian-supported workflow should include setting Estimated Time Remaining to zero

Error was: java.sql.SQLException: In der Datenbank ist bereits ein Objekt mit dem Namen 'cwd_application' vorhanden.

The *workaround* for the problem is :

+Option 1:+
1. Create a new, clean database. Use the schema name 'jiraschema'.
2. Make sure to follow the instruction on http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2008#ConnectingJIRAtoSQLServer2008-2CreateandConfiguretheSQLServerDatabase
3. Restore the backup of your current database to this db/schema. 
4. Use the [configuration tool|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2008#ConnectingJIRAtoSQLServer2008-tool] in your 4.3.3 install to add the schema name to your configuration file.
5. Try the upgrade again.


+Option 2:+
Alternatively, you can use the XML backup method for upgrading:

1. Make a XML backup of your 4.3.3 JIRA instance.
2. Run the setup wizard (connect it to a new, clean database) and log in in the new instance.
3. Restore the backup in the 4.4.3 instance.
4. Stop JIRA, copy the attachments folder from 4.3.3 home to 4.4.3 home folder.  


Regards,
Ruchi

fields.description:
JIRA appears to automatically configure and use an issue listener that handles updating the issue data in the lucene index after most issue events (IssueIndexListener).  This issue listener seems to play by the same rules as the rest of the JIRA listeners, in that it is executed in a non-deterministic order with whatever other listeners have been added.  If the ordering of this system issue listener falls AFTER the execution of a listener that updates the issue in response to an event, the correct data gets overwritten in the index.

Note the following scenario I have observed with one of our listeners:

# User comments on an issue
# Issue comment event is fired
# Our custom listener is called and updates the issue (new assignee) which in turn triggers the proper events (since we are doing the update via the Jira IssueService).
## A new round of events is fired due to this update
## This triggers a reindex through JIRA's IssueIndexListener that appears to run successfully
# JIRA's IssueIndexListener kicks in again, but now with the original IssueEvent -- the one that has the assignee value prior to our update
# Index is updated with the OLD assignee value

The failure to ensure the built in IssueIndexListener runs before user specified listeners basically results in corruption of the index causing invalid data on user dashboards and search results.  What makes it even more fun is that everything can be working just fine and the addition of a new listener could cause a reordering that breaks a configuration that was working previously.
fields.summary: IssueIndexListener indexing stale data

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Start your JIRA with Turkish locale (set -Duser.language=tr -Duser.country=TR in setenv.sh)
# Navigate to LookAndFeel page and try to update the logo
# Exceptions similar to this one will be shown in the log file:
{noformat}
2011-10-10 18:37:15,715 http-8080-2 ERROR jiraadmin 1117x509x1 16q309t 10.20.8.1:57649,127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/EditLookAndFeel.jspa [velocity] Method isDefaultFaviconOption threw exception for reference $action in template templates/actions/editlookandfeel.vm at  [72,56]
2011-10-10 18:37:15,715 http-8080-2 ERROR jiraadmin 1117x509x1 16q309t 10.20.8.1:57649,127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/EditLookAndFeel.jspa [com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager] MethodInvocationException occurred getting message body from Velocity: java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.lookandfeel.EditLookAndFeel.isDefaultFaviconOption(EditLookAndFeel.java:497)
{noformat}

*Finding:*
In this case, JIRA tries to upper case the choice made for the favicon, whether it is JIRA (DEFAULT), URL or UPLOAD. Turkish uppercasing makes it fail when trying to convert jira into JIRA, under Turkish it would actually be JİRA. 

We should always uppercase any text to be used for a programmatic purpose using English rules. We should only uppercase using the user's locale when rendering the uppercased text for the user. 

*Workaround:*
Set {{-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=UK}} into your JVM properties. For more information on how to set this, feel free to refer to:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+Properties+and+Options+on+Startup
fields.summary: NPE when updating JIRA's logo or fav icon under a Turkish locale

fields.description:
When we try to evaluate what browser is in play, we uppercase the value we get from the user agent.

Unfortunately, under turkish when we try to uppercase 'msie' we will get MSİE instead of MSIE. We should always uppercase the browser name using English rules if we are using this string for system purposes, we should only use the user's locale for uppercasing when rendering the uppercased value for the user.

Exceptions will be recorded in the logs, they will be similar to:
{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No enum const class com.atlassian.jira.util.UserAgentUtil$BrowserFamily.MS›E
	at java.lang.Enum.valueOf(Enum.java:196)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.UserAgentUtil$BrowserFamily.valueOf(UserAgentUtil.java:12)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.webfragment.conditions.IsBrowserCondition.shouldDisplay(IsBrowserCondition.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.web.conditions.InvertedCondition.shouldDisplay(InvertedCondition.java:23)
{noformat}
fields.summary: NPE when trying to evaluate the IsBrowser condition under a Turkish locale

# Create a radio button custom field # Make the radio button custom field to be required # Assign that custom field into create issue screen # Since the radio button custom field is required, the option _none_ will not be displayed on the create issue screen (the expected behavior) # Customize the Sub-Task 'Quick Create' form by adding the radio button custom field. This can be achieve by modifying the _jira.subtask.quickcreateform.fields_ on the jpm.xml. {code} jira.subtask.quickcreateform.fields summary,issuetype,assignee,timetracking,customfield_10000 list<string> false {code} # It will now display the radio buttons custom field on the Sub-Task 'Quick Create' form. However, in this case, the option _none_ is displayed even though this field is required. Therefore, on the Sub-Task 'Quick Create' form, the property _required_ is not taken into account. A workaround would be eliminating the whole if condition on the _radioedit.vm_. {code} #if (!$fieldLayoutItem || $fieldLayoutItem.required == false) #set ($checked = "") #if (!$value || $value.equals("-1")) #set ($checked = ' checked="checked"' ) #end #if($configs.options.size() > 0)
#end #end {code} However, I am not certain if there is any major implication to JIRA after deleting the if statement within the _radioedit.vm_ file. Additionally, this behavior is the same on JIRA 4.2.x, 4.3.x, 4.4.x

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26039].
  {panel}

When migrating JIRA to another server, if there are timezone inconsistencies between the two servers it can cause considerable problems with the new server that may not be discovered until problems have been introduced into the dataset. Please enhance JIRA to timestamp an XML backup and provide a warning during XML restore that the backup does not match the server time of the instance it is being imported into.
* Times stored in the database is based on the JIRA JVM user timezone

h3. Workaround

In order to restore the times back to their last known working form, the below process can be used for the new server:

# Generate an XML backup from the previous server, or obtain the last-known working one and copy it to the new JIRA server.
# Schedule a downtime window.
# Stop the new JIRA server.
# Either:
#* Set the JVM timezone argument, e.g.: {{-Duser.timezone=GMT}}, as in [Setting Timezone in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Setting+Timezone+in+JIRA].
#* Change the System Time of the server that the JVM is running on (the JVM will default to that time).
# Start the new JIRA server.
# Import the XML backup from the previous server.
# Test JIRA.

If the server is unable to be rolled back, the below can be followed, however this is not the recommend method and may cause additional problems due to time inconsistencies.

# Schedule a downtime window.
# Export the XML backup.
# Stop JIRA.
# Either:
#* Set the JVM timezone argument, e.g.: {{-Duser.timezone=GMT}}, as in [Setting Timezone in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Setting+Timezone+in+JIRA].
#* Change the System Time of the server that the JVM is running on (the JVM will default to that time).
# Start JIRA.
# Import the XML backup.
# Test JIRA.
fields.summary: Verify the system timezone when an XML backup is restored

fields.description:
Whenever we want to edit an issue, the original estimate and remaining estimate fields are loaded using local hour indicators. For example, if we originally estimated 40 hours, the field's value is 40t (t being the first letter in "time", the Danish word for hour).

But when we try to save the issue, it requires the t to be converted to h.

The problem started when we upgraded our JIRA from 4.3 to 4.4.1. Before that, we had no problems, the time indicator was always h.

I am a testleader in agile projects.

We make the testcases in Jira - the feature that will be tested as a main-task, and the testcases/teststeps as sub-tasks under that.
When we make a bug, we link the bug-task to the testcase/teststep manually. This gives ut the possibility to see the status of all bugs that is related to a testcase. There is no point retesting a teststep as long as there is unresolved bugs related to it.

If we had a function that automatically made that link when we made the bug, it would decrease work for the testers, and increase the quality of the testcase, since they always had link to the testcase the bug was discovered in (vice versa).

This feature could be under "More actions - Make bug (issue)" (automaticly reference "Is made from")
fields.summary: action to automatically create a new linked issue
